intro: Didymocheton annae, commonly known as the Annas's ghost tree, is a species of flowering plant native to the rainforests of northern Queensland, Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. Didymocheton annae is typically a small to medium-sized tree, often reaching heights of up to 10 meters. It plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing shelter and food for various wildlife species.
